register.description: The TLB chain points to another TLB. The j is the TLB number. Offset = 0h + (j * 1000h); where j = 0h to FFh

bitfield.description: Enable for the TLB. 0 = disable TLB. 1 = enable TLB.
Disable Fault Logging for the TLB. 0 = enable fault logging. 1 = disable fault logging.
A fault has been detected from this TLB that could not be logged. Will be set by hardware, and can be cleared by software.
Chain to another TLB. 0 = no chain. &gt;0 = chain to that TLB number.

register.description: The TLB Entry. The j is the TLB number, and the k is the entry number within a TLB. Offset = 20h + (j * 1000h) + (k * 20h); where j = 0h to FFh, k = 0h to 7h

bitfield.description: Virtual Base Address bits 31 to 0.

register.description: The TLB Entry. The j is the TLB number, and the k is the entry number within a TLB. Offset = 24h + (j * 1000h) + (k * 20h); where j = 0h to FFh, k = 0h to 7h

bitfield.description: Virtual Base Address bits 47 to 32.

register.description: The TLB Entry. The j is the TLB number, and the k is the entry number within a TLB. Offset = 28h + (j * 1000h) + (k * 20h); where j = 0h to FFh, k = 0h to 7h

bitfield.description: Entry mode. 0 = invalid. 1 = reserved - do not use. 2 = valid. 3 = reserved - do not use.

Enable Secure Transaction Demotion for the entry if the PVU0 is in secure mode. 0 = Secure Transactions are not affected. 1 = Secure Transactions that match the entry is demoted to non-secure out of the PVU0.
LPAE Field for Secure Page
LPAE Field for Page Size. 0 = 4K. 1 = 16K. 2 = 64K. 3 = 2M. 4 = 32M. 5 = 512M. 6 = 1G. 7 = 16G.

LPAE Field for Page Permissions. Bit 0 = enable user read access UR. Bit 1 = enable user write access UW. Bit 2 = enable user execute access UX. Bit 3 = enable supervisor read access SR. Bit 4 = enable supervisor write access SW. Bit 5 = enable supervisor execute access SX.
LPAE Field for Page Memory Type. 0 = device. 1 = write back. 2 = write through.
LPAE Field for Page Prefetch allowed
LPAE Field for Page Inner Shareable allowed
LPAE Field for Page Outer Shareable allowed
LPAE Field for Page Inner Allocation Policy. 0 = no allocate. 1 = write allocate. 2 = read allocate. 3 = read and write allocate.
LPAE Field for Page Outer Allocation Policy. 0 = no allocate. 1 = write allocate. 2 = read allocate. 3 = read and write allocate.

register.description: The TLB Entry. The j is the TLB number, and the k is the entry number within a TLB. Offset = 30h + (j * 1000h) + (k * 20h); where j = 0h to FFh, k = 0h to 7h

bitfield.description: Physical Base Address bits 31 to 0.

register.description: The TLB Entry. The j is the TLB number, and the k is the entry number within a TLB. Offset = 34h + (j * 1000h) + (k * 20h); where j = 0h to FFh, k = 0h to 7h

bitfield.description: Physical Base Address bits 47 to 32.

register.description: The TLB Entry. The j is the TLB number, and the k is the entry number within a TLB. Offset = 38h + (j * 1000h) + (k * 20h); where j = 0h to FFh, k = 0h to 7h

bitfield.description: Indicates to replace the bus orderid value when matching this entry with the ORDERID field. This allows control over the orderid value when it must be restricted due to the topology for QoS reasons. 0 = bypass and use the orderid from the source transaction for the destination transaction. 1 = use the ORDERID field value for the destination transaction.
Defines the bus orderid value for this entry if hit.
